title: 2D motion - time of flight with bounce

content.question: A projectile is launched from level ground at an initial velocity <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> as shown in the figure. At the instant the projectile is moving horizontally, it hits a wall and then bounces directly back at half the speed it had just before impact. Assuming the projectile is in contact with the wall for a negligible time, which of the following expressions represents the total time the projectile is in the air from leaving ground level to reaching ground level again?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub 0, times the sine of theta, and denominator g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3 halves times the fraction with numerator v sub 0, times the sine of theta, and denominator g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3</mn></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn></mstyle></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 times the fraction with numerator v sub 0, times the sine of theta, and denominator g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 times the fraction with numerator v sub 0, times the sine of theta, and denominator g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4</mn><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 times the fraction with numerator v sub 0, times the sine of theta, and denominator g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>
